alert.note: Alert for Brown; Monroe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:22PM EDT until June 25 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR MONROE... SOUTH CENTRAL MORGAN AND WESTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 421 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Bloomington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Unionville around 425 PM EDT. Woodville Hills and Lake Lemon around 430 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Yellowwood Lake and Helmsburg. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: If on or near Lake Monroe, get away from the water and move to safe shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves, even on small bodies of water. Move into dock and seek safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
